{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20455v1", "title": "Bi-orderability and generalized torsion elements from the perspective of
  profinite properties", "summary": "We construct bi-orderable groups from left-orderable groups via the fiber
product. As a consequence, we show that bi-orderability is not a profinite
property. This answers negatively the question of Piwek and Wykowski in the
problem list that came from participants of the workshop ``Profinite Rigidity"
held in Madrid from June 26 to June 30, 2023. Moreover, the proof can be
applied to show that the existence of a generalized torsion element is not a
profinite property.", "main_category": "math.GR", "categories": "math.GR,math.GT", "published": "2025-04-29T06:22:06Z"}
